summary: This bill, the "Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African Americans Act," establishes a commission to study and develop proposals for reparations for African Americans. The commission is tasked with examining the history of slavery, its lingering effects, and subsequent discrimination. It will recommend ways to educate the public and suggest appropriate remedies, including how to calculate and award compensation. The commission will submit a report to Congress with its findings and recommendations within a year of its first meeting.
